    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In what turned out to be an exciting and dominant display by Paris Saint-Germain (PSG), the Parc des Princes in Paris hosted Basel in a one-sided affair that saw the home team claim a commanding 3-0 victory. From the opening whistle, PSG proved their superiority in ball possession, tactical execution, and their clinical finishing abilities.

As the match kicked off, Basel had the honor of starting the play. In the opening moments at the 01:15 mark, Basel struggled to maintain possession, resulting in the first ball out of play. PSG quickly responded with a throw-in at 01:18, initiating their intention to keep the pressure on Basel. The strong start for PSG hit a minor roadblock at 02:00 with an offside call, followed by an indirect free-kick for Basel at 02:26. Nonetheless, PSG continued to dominate the ball.

The energy was palpable, and Basel, trying to find a foothold, conceded a corner at 04:44. Although Basel managed to get a shot off target from the resulting play, PSG's defensive solidity minimized the threat. Basel's aggressive approach led to their foul at 05:30, giving PSG an indirect free-kick at 05:41. Both sides exchanged possession frequently in the opening minutes as the teams settled into the rhythm of the match.

By the midpoint of the first half, PSG began to showcase their attacking prowess more prominently. A series of attacks resulted in a notable attempt at the 10:05 mark when Basel managed to get a shot on target, which was then deflected off. Despite their brief momentum, Basel's offensive efforts couldn't force the breakthrough. Their defensive squad had to constantly manage PSG's forward drives, eventually conceding another foul at 11:08, favoring PSG with another indirect free-kick.

PSG’s constant offensive plays finally bore fruit in the second half of the game, following numerous prior attempts. For instance, at the 11:47 mark, PSG made an ambitious attempt from a distance; however, it went wide off the target.

Throughout the first half, intermittent fouls hampered Basel’s rhythm and helped PSG maintain dominance. At 13:52, a foul by Basel provided PSG with another set-piece opportunity, but they couldn’t capitalize on it immediately. As the clock neared the 18-minute mark, both teams exhibited impatience in their defensive lines, leading to multiple ball-out-of-play situations.

As the first half entered its final moments, the deadlock was broken. At the 39:22 mark, PSG orchestrated a well-crafted play that concluded with a clinical shot on target, outsmarting Basel's goalkeeping efforts. The precise execution by PSG found its way to the back of the net, lighting up the stadium with jubilation. Basel, rattled but determined, resumed with a kick-off at 40:27, but couldn't produce an immediate response before the halftime whistle. 

Resuming the second half, PSG came out with renewed vigor. Basel, trailing by a goal, showed signs of urgency but was met with a disciplined Parisian defense. Basel’s fight led to an early foul on PSG at the 01:14 mark, allowing PSG to take a free-kick which, although not converted, signaled their attacking intentions for the next period.

As the second half unfolded, Basel put forth more physicality, leading to consistent foul play. A remarkable set of events at the 16:07 mark saw PSG once again making their way towards Basel’s goal. A well-coordinated move resulted in a stunning shot on target, followed by another quick succession of attacking plays. They successfully doubled their tally at the 16:36 mark, reinforcing their dominance and putting Basel under immense pressure with a 2-0 lead.

Basel, attempting to salvage pride, continued their efforts, but PSG's defensive organization stymied their advances. Basel's trouble was compounded when they picked up a yellow card at 20:29 following a foul at 20:23 – a reflection of their growing frustrations on the field.

With a 2-0 cushion, PSG shifted their gear slightly, allowing for cautious control over the proceedings while still pushing for more goals. This tactical brilliance kept Basel from finding any substantial scoring opportunities. PSG’s calculated management of the game saw them make strategic substitutions, injecting fresh legs into the side. Their substitute at 35:05 typified their approach to maintain intensity and defensive stamina.

As the game neared its end, PSG looked to put the result beyond any doubt. Their relentless pressure yielded another crucial moment close to full-time. Basel’s repeated fouls yet again cost them dearly. PSG earned a penalty kick at 47:13, confidently taken and successfully converting it into their third goal of the night, sealing the match at a comprehensive 3-0 victory as the final whistle blew shortly after the resulting kickoff at 48:05.

Throughout the 90 minutes, PSG showcased a masterclass in both attacking finesse and defensive resilience. Basel, despite their best efforts, couldn’t match PSG’s superiority in all departments – leaving the home fans with plenty to cheer about. Each goal by PSG was a testament to their tactical executions, while their defensive setups suffocated Basel’s forwards, highlighting a gulf in class on the night.

This lopsided but entertaining fixture highlighted PSG’s readiness and formidable strength this season. Their consistent probing, creative link-up plays, and defensive discipline certainly mark them as strong contenders in upcoming fixtures. Basel, meanwhile, will need to regroup and address their shortcomings in both defensive errors and foul discipline if they are to hope for better outcomes in their future matches.
